package.name: Solar
package.summary: Simple object library and application repository for PHP.
package.description:
Solar is a class library and application component suite for PHP 5 (and is PHP5 E_STRICT compliant). Solar provides simple, easy-to-comprehend classes and components for the common aspects of web-based rapid application development.
Solar is designed for developers who intend to distribute their applications to the whole world. This means, for example, the database driver functions work exactly the same way for each supported database. It also means that localization support is built in from the start.
Please visit http://solarphp.com/ for more information.

release.notes:
* WARNING: This is a public development release, and is not yet stable.
* Solar:
* Changed $shared to protected, not public, because some shared objects may not be instantiated at start() time. From now on, use Solar::shared() to access shared singleton objects; this will instantiate the object if it does not already exist. Updated all related code throughout Solar to reflect this change.
* Solar_Base:
* Added errorPush() for stacking onto existing Solar_Error objects
* Now have an explicit $config['locale'] key set to null
* Added test suite
* Solar_Error:
* Added $obj parameter to push and pop callbacks (to send the Solar_Error object itself to the callback)
* You can now transfer error stacks between Solar_Error objects using push()
* Added test suite
* Solar_Locale:
* The load() method now fails silently if you try to load a translation file that doesn't exist. It's often the case that some translations exist and others don't; thus, the non-existence of the file shouldn't throw a warning, as the displayed output clearly shows that keys are being returned instead of translations.
* On setCode(), now reloads the Solar-wide translation keys for the new locale.
* Added test suite (tests Solar::shared('locale') and Solar_Base::locale() as well)

* WARNING: This is a public development release, and is not yet stable.
* Solar:
* Changed $shared to protected, not public, because some shared objects may not be instantiated at start() time. From now on, use Solar::shared() to access shared singleton objects; this will instantiate the object if it does not already exist. Updated all related code throughout Solar to reflect this change.
* Solar_Base:
* Added errorPush() for stacking onto existing Solar_Error objects
* Now have an explicit $config['locale'] key set to null
* Added test suite
* Solar_Error:
* Added $obj parameter to push and pop callbacks (to send the Solar_Error object itself to the callback)
* You can now transfer error stacks between Solar_Error objects using push()
* Added test suite
* Solar_Locale:
* The load() method now fails silently if you try to load a translation file that doesn't exist. It's often the case that some translations exist and others don't; thus, the non-existence of the file shouldn't throw a warning, as the displayed output clearly shows that keys are being returned instead of translations.
* On setCode(), now reloads the Solar-wide translation keys for the new locale.
* Added test suite (tests Solar::shared('locale') and Solar_Base::locale() as well)
